message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IT, cs.SI 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with image representation and classification. It also involves the use of wavelet transforms, which are commonly used in computer vision tasks. 

The paper also involves the use of deep learning techniques, which suggests that it could belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. 

The use of a Gaussian kernel SVM and a generative PCA classifier suggests that the paper could also belong to the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category. 

The mathematical analysis of wavelet scattering networks suggests that the paper could also belong to the information theory (cs.IT) sub-category. 

Finally, the use of scattering representation of stationary processes suggests that the paper could also belong to the signal processing (cs.SI) sub-category.
